intro: Tarenna baconoides, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Tarenna baconoides thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and culinary uses make it a notable species in its native habitat.
